revised_title: Solar Prominence and Spot Circulation: A Study of 1872-1901
tldr: This article discusses the connection between solar, meteorological, and magnetic changes, focusing on the variation of solar prominences and sunspots from 1872 to 1901. The authors analyze two sets of prominence observations to study the changes in latitude and intensity of these phenomena, concluding that prominence activity generally has a poleward drift and may not follow a consistent cycle for each solar cycle.
